snippet: No place in the beleaguered country has suffered as severely as Aden, a blockaded port city captive to deadly street fighting for the better part of a month.
abstract: Yemen's southern port city of Aden stands as testament to suffering in country wracked with violence; city has seen ferocious street fighting for weeks, leaving almost 200 people dead and residents deprived of basic resources like water, fuel and electricity; as forces loyal to government of Pres Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi have left, many residents have formed local militias to battle against Houthi rebels and forces loyal to former Pres Ali Abdullah Saleh.

byline.original: By FATHI BIN-LAZRQ and KAREEM FAHIM
byline.contributor: Fathi Bin-Lazrq reported from Aden, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Saeed al-Batati contributed reporting from Dowaan, Yemen, and Merna Thomas from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: No place in the beleaguered country has suffered as severely as Aden, a blockaded port city captive to deadly street fighting for the better part of a month.

headline.main: Yemen’s Despair on Full Display in ‘Ruined’ City
headline.print_headline: Yemen’s Despair on Full Display in ‘Ruined’ City
